segments.text: How could we advertise our celebrations to mark the centenary of the founding of the university ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ m sure we could get one or two tv companies to come in . Perhaps the president could invite them and do an interview .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ s a good idea . We could put up some posters in and around the campus with a list of events . It would be quite cheap to do on the campus .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It will be expensive to do outside the campus . Perhaps we could arrange for some sponsorship .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We could contact alumni who work for large , well-know companies . They might be able to arrange cheap advertising in exchange for some free tickets .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Good thinking ! We should also print some leaflets for students to distribute .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We should put some information about it on the home page of our university website . When people visit the website , they ’ ll see the information .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We could take out some advertisements to local newspapers . I checked the prices and they are reasonable .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Ok . Let ’ s get to work on our advertising campaign .
segments.speaker: S1
